intro: Peltogyne campestris var. campestris, commonly known as the African mahogany, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces hard, heavy wood that is highly valued for its strength and durability. It typically grows in dry savanna and woodland habitats. Due to overharvesting, it is also considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
